Thank you for the texts everyone — I'm not at YouTube HQ this week. I'm home safe in DC. They've evacuated the buildings and as far as I know, everyone I work with is safe and accounted for. Hoping everyone else is OK. https://t.co/FTRaU7kGeJ
@kustoo @YouTube My dude, thank you for the TSP love. Wish you could’ve joined me, @nils_hh, @scottycrowe, and @isabellefuhrman in the desert... next year! https://t.co/vR4kgiJxsh

@ActualArash @Uber I know that trick, but I'm referring to actual routing I've seen the @Uber GPS gives drivers. Going from Shaw to Georgetown should never take me out to Virginia, out onto 395, onto the GW Parkway, and across Key Bridge.
@josephkeefer @Uber Yeah, no.
@bohan @Uber OMG, so ridiculous. I've had to show drivers how to select a different default GPS app in their settings before.

I've been saying this. @Uber's proprietary GPS is absolute TRASH. In DC, it frequently takes me out to Virginia and back into DC. Currently, in an Uber in LA, where the GPS took me through an In-n-Out parking lot and back out. Yes, I thought about stopping for a Double Double. https://t.co/MmFYhGiMSF
@TheSmarmyBum Yo, THEE worst.

Thank you to the patron of saint of food @chefjoseandres, @andpizza, and @SugarShackDMV for providing thousands of meals to feed students and marchers for FREE. That sandwich saved me. #marchforourlives #foodforourlives https://t.co/OKOtdokHCB
These aren’t our future leaders. These are our leaders of today. #marchforourlives https://t.co/mTqWWIm7HY

Of all the photos I took at #marchforourlives, this one made me cry.
“Before this started, I didn’t think kids had a voice. People always think we’re always lolligaging and don’t take anything seriously. But this shows we can be serious. And I want to do my part.” -Dymaris, 14 https://t.co/ExGWkYtRZq

@alexisohanian Fun watching v confused kids, too young for smartphones, try to figure out how to ride them. @limebike launched theirs this week in DC too. Interesting space with virtually no barriers to market entry. Dockless bikes here are already a mess.

RT @marcus_arman: Idle idols. https://t.co/amxnhBJ3hD
@NTagouri Sound familiar? https://t.co/CTkDKIRiFz
@redgaskell It's on both. The idolized need to be conscious of the power they wield and use it responsibly. The people who idolize should not do so blindly.
@tammy YES! Totally.
@tammy It’s a common Craigslist scam. https://t.co/vsV5KNc6Fh

@1a @AndyPuzder I don’t have a problem with capitalism, but @AndyPuzder made millions annually as CEO of CKE. I understand execs take outsized risk, but how does he justify making 2-300x employees? Do he & shareholders really suffer if they make a few million less?
@bryce https://t.co/Wi7V9aWySU
Thread. https://t.co/yg8iPrQdV1
RT @CorbinReiff: Imagine being THIS tone-deaf, my lord! https://t.co/3LsB1Ln5h8
Save yourself the trouble... don’t idolize people. Idols will always let you down. https://t.co/3aYs0nj59g
Anyone know when the last time MAGA trended in the United States? 😞 https://t.co/D40VMDNj0l

The hypocrisy of it all: we're all still gonna bump those new Kanye albums and cop tickets to his next tour, aren't we?
No one passes the purity test.

Shout out to @OnAwardTour and @MadburyClub for the 🔥 shirts they made for Carmelita’s Deli in BK and the $6,000 they made for the Young Center for Immigrant Children’s Rights and the Hurricane Harvey Relief Fund. https://t.co/ZWcxzjYlq2

@Avrg_Geek @TataMumMarathon @NikeLA The Mumbai Marathon is owned and produced by Procam International. Tata and all the other sponsors just write checks to sponsor. Next year it could be the Microsoft Mumbai Marathon or whoever wants to be the biggest bidder. Nike doesn’t share the spotlight; takes all the risk.
@willbradley @dosh @PConnery @startupdaemon @mmay3r @morganhousel OMG THANK YOU FOR THIS @FORBES ARTICLE
@gabealonso I judge everyone’s shoes, everywhere tbh.
RT @JoeFreshgoods: hey kids. be honest. I’ve been going into these meetings with these big companies just being myself and telling them if…

@Avrg_Geek @TataMumMarathon The difference is the @TataMumMarathon is sponsored by dozens of brands who pay organizers to do the actual hard work — writing a check is very low risk.
The @NikeLA 10k has no additonal sponsors and they produced it all themselves — much higher risk.
@EugeneKan @diplo We'll have to continue this convo in IRL next time I come out to Hong Kong. Sorry for blowing up your mentions @diplo.
@EugeneKan @diplo A really interesting read in @TheAtlantic post-@YouTube shooting, somewhat related to this... https://t.co/5eaileZm7b
@EugeneKan @diplo And when there is injustice in culture, they must give their voice to others who don't have one. They can no longer afford to be agnostic. https://t.co/IkXg3NegGC

@EugeneKan @diplo I don't think there's a difference anymore. There's a reason mission-driven businesses are thriving right now. Generally, I believe celebs, athletes, and brands are a reflection of culture and wield tremendous power to change it.
@EugeneKan @diplo Taking freedom and democracy for granted and complacency are what have gotten us into this whole mess. We got comfortable.

@EugeneKan @diplo I agree with your first point — that requires even more courage. As you suspected, I disagree with your second. Longer convo, but with everything going on in the world, no one can afford to not be engaged in politics anymore. "Shutting up and dribbling" is a form of privilege.
@amytangerine That's awesome, congrats Amy!
@Inc So “Twitterer” is a word now, I see.

@EugeneKan Lack of distinction. Being unremarkable. Any brand can pull off a 5k or 10k, but what makes it a lasting memory beyond the medal? Running down an empty highway in LA or taking the Manhattan Bridge (at night) with @diplo on the other side... you’ll be telling that story forever.
YES. It’s not just about having resources. Just because you have money doesn’t mean you’ll gamble. https://t.co/ISMkqUn6RA
@jinkwell YES. So true.
@stelystel Congrats!
@cguzzle @blk_tray @Nike @UnderArmour Lol k.

@PeterAbraham I think that was more my point. I also recognize taking risk is a privilege that comes with having resources, but it has to be baked into the culture of the brand. And it has to start somewhere, even if small.
@Local_Boy_ Almost every time someone (usually in marketing themselves) finds out I worked there... Then they ask me if I got free shoes when I was there. (I did)
@JothamKitara True, resources are always a factor. But a brand or business’s willingness to take risk and defy convention, in even small ways, is what separates good from great.
@cguzzle @blk_tray Oh really? https://t.co/cIy6pCzt4n

@PeterAbraham True. But it definitely wasn’t the easier option. Lots of other roads they could’ve chosen to close — but it married up to their campaign storyline and carried historic signicance. Plus, isn’t getting a film permit considerably easier than a race/event permit?
RT @dtrinh: Ran this this morning and will have a lifelong memory for it 👇🏼 https://t.co/NHUpZzVb9v
